meanings.definition: Tices (verb): to entice or persuade someone to do something
meanings.sent1: She tices her friends with promises of delicious treats.
meanings.sent2: The salesman tices customers with special offers.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox tices the rabbit out of its burrow with a shiny object.
meanings.sent4: The sly magician tices the audience with his mesmerizing tricks.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies tices everyone to the kitchen.

meanings.definition: Tices (noun): a small device or gadget
meanings.sent1: He always carries around his favorite tices in his pocket.
meanings.sent2: The spy used hidden tices to gather information.
meanings.sent3: The little tices in the toy store caught the child's attention.
meanings.sent4: The intricate tices in the watch make it a valuable collectible.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's latest invention includes innovative tices for better efficiency.

meanings.definition: Tices (adjective): having a tendency to entice or attract
meanings.sent1: The tices advertisement drew a large crowd to the event.
meanings.sent2: The shop window displayed tices products to lure in customers.
meanings.sent3: The charming garden had tices flowers that brightened up the yard.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious aura of the old mansion had a tices allure.
meanings.sent5: The sparkling decorations created a tices atmosphere for the party.
